comments.body: consider calling this something like "DimpleNotchedRectangle" or some such, to make it clearer what the difference is between this and a semicircular notched rectangle.

Naming here is pretty hard...
For a few moments I thought that once we expose the curve computation parameters (s1 and s2) we will avoid this naming problem, as one could configure this to be equivalent to the single arc notch, but there's actually no such setting for s1 and s2.

Another option would be to add a `smooth` boolean parameter to this class, but that's also not ideal as when it's false the s1/s2 parameters (which I plan to expose anyway) will be meaningless.

@HansMuller maybe you have some thoughts here?
Maybe generate a simple circular notch if the s1/s2 parameters are null but have them default to values that produce a dimple.
I'm ok with that - if either s1 or s2 are null we'll just default to the single arc notch. An this thing stays the CircularNotchedRectangle.
Shouldn't there be s1/s2 constructor parameters?
bonus points for adding a code example showing this in use (additional bonus points for including an image that shows the result).
I'm going to pass on this for now... I wasn't quite able to figure out what the right way to demonstrate this was.
I guess this was just a cleanup and you can't actually remove this ignore.
